Varroc Observation: Small Scratch mark observed on spigot OD .
Outflow Root Cause: Visual Checking 100 % at final Q Gate But operator not awerness for this problem .
Outflow Root Cause side action: OJT given by Final inspector .
Occurrence Root Cause:
Analysis- Scratches are happened at the spigot section while checking  mounting dimensions in Final Assembly gauge, since it is blind position in Gauge and hardness of gauge is more than FEC, scratches happens.
Discussed with RE to not to book these parts and has no concerns of fit and and function.
Occurrence Root Cause Side Action:
Instead of 100% inspection , 25 nos., per lot checked in gauge. Frequency revised.
Refresh Training given to 3Rd party inspector regarding verification of parts in gauge.

Outflow Root Cause:
Starter Motor was OK at the time of mfg. and checking , same was certified by 3rd party.
( Handling and transit concerns.)
Outflow Root Cause side action: As a part of ICA , Motor inserted into bubble bag after Q Gate itself to avoid handling concerns at inhouse.
Occurrence Root Cause: Peel off is due to rubbing of motor lugs (eccentric)  with lugs of either side of  motors, with separators in bin and with positive terminal of either side of motors, during transit.
Occurrence Root Cause Side Action:
Bins are getting modified to have fixed position for motors which will avoid rotation of motors.
And chamfer provision feasibility is getting checked  in mounting holes at casting level to avoid peel off during handling and transit.
System Action: Packing std to be updated after change implementation

Outflow Root Cause: Lump formed in raw material not properly disperse during mixing.
Outflow Root Cause side action:
One-point lesson displayed.
OJT given to operator.
Check point added at raw material mixing stage to checked the absence of lump.
Occurrence Root Cause: Input material weight ( Final batch rubber compound) kept higher tolerance to have good material flow in mold to avoid under fills which has caused thick flash
Occurrence Root Cause Side Action:
De-flashing process revisited and checking done with magnifying glass. Lump formed in chemicals will be crushed during mixing process.
Input material weight revisited and optimised.

System Action: ECRN submitted  to R&D &awaiting for customer feedback.
Remarks: Effectiveness monitoring will be done June onwards
